comments:
There are valid scenarios where you can have unknown profiling types present 
in the profiling monitor.. this happens in higher products. Consider the case 
where there is a new component installed which contributed new profiling 
types, the user profiles some application using it, saves the data, then 
uninstalls that component. The next time the workbench is started, the 
Profiling Monitor is trying to show profiling types that it doesn't know 
anything about.

The current behavior is to show the general "An error has occured" dialog, and 
a NullPointerException is logged (see below). We need to fail more gracefully 
in this case. Some possibilities:

1. Ignore unknown profiling types and simply don't show them.
2. Tell the user that there's a profiling type it doesn't know about, and that 
it won't be shown.

Since UI freeze has passed, will probably go with option 1.

Unable to reproduce this in 3.3. I was using 3.0.2 originally. There were a 
few changes since that apparently fixed the problem.
